channel.title: Examples on nRF5dev
channel.description: Recent content in Examples on nRF5dev

item.title: Saadc
item.description: In this example we’ll be looking at building a simplified version of the Saadc example in the nRF5 SDK. The Saadc (Successive approximation analog-to-digital converter) is a peripheral used to convert analog signals into digital signals, in the nRF5 based SOCs. Hardware : To build and test our example, we’ll be using an nRF52 based development kit. You can either use the nRF52-DK or the nRF52840-DK. The nRF52 series of SOCs feature an 8 channel based Saadc, with pins naming starting from AIN0 to AIN7.
